meanings.sent1: The reescalation of the argument only made things worse.
meanings.sent2: The reescalation of tensions between the two countries led to a conflict.
meanings.sent3: The reescalation of the food fight in the cafeteria was unexpected.
meanings.sent4: The reescalation of the race for the presidency heated up quickly.
meanings.sent5: The reescalation of the storm brought heavy rain and strong winds.

meanings.definition: To increase in intensity or extent again.
meanings.sent1: She decided to reescalate her efforts to finish the project on time.
meanings.sent2: The company had to reescalate their marketing strategies to attract more customers.
meanings.sent3: He had to reescalate the volume on the TV to hear the dialogue clearly.
meanings.sent4: The team captain chose to reescalate the team's training regimen for better performance.
meanings.sent5: The chef had to reescalate the heat on the stove to cook the steak perfectly.
